    for i in range(n_circles):

        row = i // grid_size
        col = i % grid_size
        x = (col + 0.5) / grid_size
        y = (row + 0.5) / grid_size
        centers.append([x, y])

    n_circles = len(centers)
    
    # Check boundaries
    for i in range(n_circles):
        if (centers[i, 0] - radii[i] < -tol or 
            centers[i, 0] + radii[i] > 1 + tol or
            centers[i, 1] - radii[i] < -tol or 
            centers[i, 1] + radii[i] > 1 + tol):

    # Check overlaps

        for j in range(i+1, n_circles):
            dist = np.sqrt((centers[i, 0] - centers[j, 0])**2 +

            if dist < radii[i] + radii[j] - tol:

    return True


def create_grid_packing(n_circles: int) -> Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]:
    """Fallback grid packing"""
    grid_size = int(np.ceil(np.sqrt(n_circles)))
    spacing = 1.0 / grid_size
    radius = spacing / 2.5
    
    centers = []
    for i in range(n_circles):
        row = i // grid_size
        col = i % grid_size
        x = (col + 0.5) * spacing
        y = (row + 0.5) * spacing
        centers.append([x, y])
    
    centers = np.array(centers)
    radii = np.full(n_circles, radius)
    
    return centers, radii
